result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M. Knapp

records.addlTxt:
9:17 AM Defendant Jason M. Knapp in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy  in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jason M. Knapp. 
Cases heard today are 22CF26 and 22CF188.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF26:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2 - Guilty 

22CF188:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 in 22CF26:  Possession of Methamphetamine 961.41(3g)(g)
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
**Dismissed and Read In:
Count 1 of 22CF26
Count 1 & 2 of 22CF188

ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing

BY THE COURT: 
22CF26:
Count 2:
Sentence Withheld
If revoked, 3 days of pretrial incarceration credit 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 24 Months -
**Conditions of Probation:
AODA  Assessment & comply with treatment recommendations from that assessment, if he has not had one in the last 12 months 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
No contact with co-defendants, Christina Ross and Tomie Pizzino - to be left to the discretion of the agent 
Pay $100 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Provide DNA sample 

20 days to appeal

ADDRESS INFO for Jason M. Knapp
Current: 500 Forest St., Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 01-13-2022)
Prior: 2501 Forest Dr # 178, Plover, WI 54467
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:00 PM Defendant Jason M. Knapp in court.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jason M. Knapp.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:50 PM Defendant Jason M. Knapp in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jason M. Knapp. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for May 9, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 2
Follow all open bond conditions, in particular, do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:34 PM Defendant Jason M Knapp appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Maxwell Bergner for Jason M Knapp appeared in court, Attorney Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Fentanyl and Bail Jumping. 
Atty Bergner indicates the defendant does qualify for public defender. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $250 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments to the court and requests a signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
